title:
IC 10 X-1: A Double Black Hole Progenitor Probably Formed through Stable
  Mass Transfer
authors: Gui-Yu Wang, Yong Shao, Jian-Guo He, Xiao-Jie Xu, Xiang-Dong Li
abstract:
IC 10 X-1 is one of close X-ray binaries containing a Wolf-Rayet donor, which
can provide an evolutionary link between high-mass X-ray binaries and
gravitational wave sources. It is still unclear about the precise nature of the
accreting compact object in IC 10 X-1, although it looks more like a black hole
than a neutron star. In this work, we use a binary population synthesis method
to simulate the formation of IC 10 X-1 like binaries by assuming different
common-envelope ejection efficiencies. This work represents a big step forward
over previous studies since we adopt new criteria of mass-transfer stability.
These criteria allow the formation of IC 10 X-1 like systems without
experiencing common envelope evolution. Based on our calculations, we propose
that the compact object in IC 10 X-1 is a black hole with mass of $\sim
10-30M_\odot$ and the progenitor evolution of this binary probably just
experienced stable mass transfer.
